channel.title: The iPad
channel.description:
The iPad is Apple's newest technological wonder, which was released at their conference a couple days ago. [img]http://www.iphonesavior.com/images/2008/05/14/ipad_touch_mock_up.jpg[/img] Basically it is a bigger version of the iPod Touch. You can surf the web, view photos, download/play applications, buy music, watch videos, and everything else you could do on the standard iPod Touch. Some new features include a version that supports AT&T's 3G network, only 29.99 per month for unlimited data. And there is no contract involved ;) Specs
# 9.7-inch (diagonal) LED-backlit glossy widescreen Multi-Touch display with IPS technology # 1024-by-768-pixel resolution at 132 pixels per inch (ppi) 1GHz Apple A4 custom-designed, high-performance, low-power system-on-a-chip # 30-pin dock connector # 3.5-mm stereo headphone jack # Built-in speaker # Microphone Wi-Fi model * Wi-Fi (802.11a/b/g/n) * Bluetooth 2.1 + EDR technology Wi-Fi + 3G model * UMTS/HSDPA (850, 1900, 2100 MHz) * GSM/EDGE (850, 900, 1800, 1900 MHz) * Data only2 * Wi-Fi (802.11a/b/g/n) * Bluetooth 2.1 + EDR technology Audio playback * Frequency response: 20Hz to 20,000Hz * Audio formats supported: AAC (16 to 320 Kbps), Protected AAC (from iTunes Store), MP3 (16 to 320 Kbps), MP3 VBR, Audible (formats 2, 3, and 4), Apple Lossless, AIFF, and WAV * User-configurable maximum volume limit Viewable document types: .jpg, .tiff, .gif (images); .doc and .docx (Microsoft Word); .htm and .html (web pages); .key (Keynote); .numbers (Numbers); .pages (Pages); .pdf (Preview and Adobe Acrobat); .ppt and .pptx (Microsoft PowerPoint); .txt (text); .rtf (rich text format); .vcf (contact information); .xls and .xlsx (Microsoft Excel)
In my opinion, not the most revolutionary technology. It has some cool features, but it is not an outstanding piece of hardware.

item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

I want an iPhone, just for pay as you go they cost fuck loads and I can’t keep up paying for a contract as I have insurance bills to cover.

item.title: The iPad
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:20, topic:328131”][quote author=Kane. link=topic=424513.msg3120035#msg3120035 date=1265460274]

Problem with the iPhone is that it misses out the simple features that everyone wants in a phone, things like vibrate. If you had the iPhone on silent you wouldn’t ever know if you received a message, or someone was calling you.

What are you on about? They do vibrate on silent.
[/quote]
I was told the iPhone didn’t have vibrate o_o[/quote]
Oh god, never talk to that person again.

Read full topic

item.title: The iPad
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Kane., post:16, topic:328131”]Pretty sure my post had one link with a full explanation behind it?
Are you blind or just can’t read? maybe you disregarded it because it’s all true? Hmm.

Point is, there will be a lot more positivity about the iPhone than any other phone.
No phone is as famous as the iPhone.

I’ve stated my point, differ of opinions, but this thread is about the shitty iPad. So let’s drop it now.[/quote]One expects the person discussing to have the required knowledge to debate, not a random website. It is not nearly as interesting that way.

I never denied that iPhone is the most famous phone in existance, but that is not only because it is “the best” phone. Apple had a massive marketing campaign.

That is true. IPAD IS A PIECE OF ANUS AND LICK MY BALLS

Read full topic

item.title: The iPad
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Kane., post:14, topic:328131”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=424513.msg3119264#msg3119264 date=1265385482]
Ps the iPhone isn’t revolutionary at all. All the functionality it has can be found in earlier devices. The only way it is revolutionary is in the sense that it’s a commercial success. It’s a bit like idiots saying WoW is revolutionary while it isn’t in any way so.
[/quote]
Just because it has functions that others previously had doesn’t make it non revolutionary. Everything has a relateable function of something.

But the way it’s built (everything I mentioned before) makes it a lot different.
See all the competitors bringing out phones to try and match the iPhone with similar features?

Everyone’s starting to bring in app stores and music stores able to be connected by the phone.
Like I said, the facts are there.

It was such a giant hit because of how amazing it is, not because Apple fans bought it for the sake of being an iPhone holder and it’s following persona. Before the iPhone Apple didn’t have hardly as much success as they do now.
Because it appeals to many audiences.

I see iPhones everywhere. Everyones getting them, and everyone loves them.
Just because a few people on an elitist forum trying to uphold their reputation of being e-different for their e-penis doesn’t make anything they say true.

It is revolutionary. You’re wrong, sorry.

http://www.google.com.au/search?hl=en&source=hp&q=iPhone+revolutionary&btnG=Google+Search&meta=&aq=f&oq=
You will find more pages about the iPhone revolution than any other phone that exists.[/quote]I can find random links without explaining them as well:

Slate Magazine

Slate’s Use of Your Data

Slate’s Use of Your Data


http://www.iphonessuck.com/145/the-iphone-is-not-a-revolutionary-invention
Neowin

iPhone..NOT a revolutionary phone!

Steve jobs touted that iPhone is a Revolutionary phone, High technology, Breakthrough internet device with Widescreen ipod is all above true?...No..Not at all...All those technologies are already available!! (Except for widescreen ipod & [finger]...


http://forums.cnet.com/5208-10152_102-0.html?threadID=229831
glg.it

GLG - Gerson Lehrman Group

GLG: The world's leading platform for professional learning.

and the list can go on.

Read full topic

item.title: The iPad
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“Kane., post:10, topic:328131”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=424513.msg3118652#msg3118652 date=1265300361]

The iPhone, iPod and MacBooks are the only things worthy of owning.
The prices are ridiculous though.

As an iPhone user I have to say It’s the best phone I’ve ever used.
This iPad crap is a fucking joke.

Can’t even multi task.

Can you tell me what’s so good about the iPhone?
[/quote]
Easy interface, smooth transition, fast, the billions of applications, apple’s approach to iPod’s is superior (hence the sales)- combining this with a phone was brilliance, gps definitely comes in handy.

You can down talk apple, but the facts are there. The iPhone is a revolutionary multipurpose device.
Trying to be cool by acting against the click because they are popular and a success isn’t working.[/quote]

I’m not going to say the iPhone isn’t revolutionary because I know it is and I have one myself.

But I hate just about everything else from Apple, including the iPad.

It’s not any better than the iPhone or iTouch. There are numerous downsides. It doesn’t do anything very well. I can think of one use for it and that is to remote desktop connect to my PC because of the screen size and portability. Other than that, it’s pretty much a scam.

There does come a point when their popularity and success isn’t a product of their products but of their success and popularity itself.

Read full topic

Trying to be cool by acting against the click because they are popular and a success isn’t working.

item.dc:creator: @Syfal Syfal
item.description:
@Syfal wrote:

Unhandled:

Hi stop trying to sell me a shitty product.

Wasn’t trying to.

To clarify, I don’t have the iPad, and I don’t plan to buy it. I just think the 3G being included is a cool feature. I do think it is mostly a piece of junk.

I included the specs for people who might want to know a little bit more about it than the dull expose I offered above.

Read full topic

item.title: The iPad
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

These have been around for years, as usual Apple give something a makeover, advertise the shit out of it and all of a sudden people think it’s the next big thing. It disgusts me to think people are wasting money on these and that someone somewhere is getting very rich because of their marketing department’s ability to manipulate the population into thinking apple products are cool.

I’ve never owned an apple product and never will. That company turned evil when Steve Wozniak left after the Apple I & II. The only decent things they ever made.

Read full topic

@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

It’s what Apple has been doing for that last decade or so: Selling crap to idiots who think that owning something made by Apple makes them cool. Well, I tell you one thing: IT MAKES YOU AS SHALLOW AS HELL!

Basically, it’s crap. It’s “All in one”, yet it sucks at everything.

Read full topic

item.title: The iPad
item.dc:creator: @Syfal Syfal
item.description:
@Syfal wrote:

The iPad is Apple’s newest technological wonder, which was released at their conference a couple days ago.

Basically it is a bigger version of the iPod Touch. You can surf the web, view photos, download/play applications, buy music, watch videos, and everything else you could do on the standard iPod Touch.

Some new features include a version that supports AT&T’s 3G network, only 29.99 per month for unlimited data. And there is no contract involved

Specs

# 9.7-inch (diagonal) LED-backlit glossy widescreen Multi-Touch display with IPS technology # 1024-by-768-pixel resolution at 132 pixels per inch (ppi)

1GHz Apple A4 custom-designed, high-performance, low-power system-on-a-chip

30-pin dock connector

3.5-mm stereo headphone jack

Built-in speaker

Microphone

Wi-Fi model

* Wi-Fi (802.11a/b/g/n)
* Bluetooth 2.1 + EDR technology

Wi-Fi + 3G model

* UMTS/HSDPA (850, 1900, 2100 MHz)
* GSM/EDGE (850, 900, 1800, 1900 MHz)
* Data only2
* Wi-Fi (802.11a/b/g/n)
* Bluetooth 2.1 + EDR technology

Audio playback

* Frequency response: 20Hz to 20,000Hz
* Audio formats supported: AAC (16 to 320 Kbps), Protected AAC (from iTunes Store), MP3 (16 to 320 Kbps), MP3 VBR, Audible (formats 2, 3, and 4), Apple Lossless, AIFF, and WAV
* User-configurable maximum volume limit

Viewable document types: .jpg, .tiff, .gif (images); .doc and .docx (Microsoft Word); .htm and .html (web pages); .key (Keynote); .numbers (Numbers); .pages (Pages); .pdf (Preview and Adobe Acrobat); .ppt and .pptx (Microsoft PowerPoint); .txt (text); .rtf (rich text format); .vcf (contact information); .xls and .xlsx (Microsoft Excel)

In my opinion, not the most revolutionary technology. It has some cool features, but it is not an outstanding piece of hardware.

Read full topic
